content:
CC100 3/13/23
© Michelle Dumas 2023 1
Crime Prevention
– Instructions &
Tips
CC100-A Introduction to Criminology
Week 9
1
© Michelle Dumas 2023
Due Date
• Due: Tues, March 28, 2023, by 11:59 pm
• If you choose to take the 4-day extension for this
assignment, it must be submitted before Sat, April 1,
2023, by 11:59 pm.
• The Dropbox will close on Wed, April 5, 2023, at 11:59
pm.
• Late penalties will apply to any assignment submitted
between Apr 2 and Apr 5 – 5% per day.
© Michelle Dumas 2023 2
CC100 3/13/23
© Michelle Dumas 2023 2
Background
• As noted in chapter 11 of the text, Canada, in contrast to
the United States, has largely focused on a social
responsibility method of crime prevention rather than
individual responsibility (Schmalleger & Volk, 2022,
p.282).
• For this assignment, we will focus on the one that is most
observable: protection/avoidance strategies, particularly
those achieved through environmental design (also
known as CPTED).
© Michelle Dumas 2023 3
Goal
• The goal is to observe and record at 2 different types
of protection/avoidance strategies in a
neighbourhood – whether around the University,
Waterloo, at home, or any other – in Canada.
• One must be an example of “surveillance” and one
must be an example of “access control” (see p. 291 &
292, chapter 11 and week 10 lecture).
© Michelle Dumas 2023 4
CC100 3/13/23
© Michelle Dumas 2023 3
Goal
• In your report, you will provide photo evidence of
these strategies – these photos can only be those
taken by you. They should not be from online
sources or from other students in class.
• Additionally, written evidence will be provided of the
CP strategy being used, why they are CP strategies,
and evaluate them. It is expected to be short and
succinct (maximum 2-page write-up per example).
[does not include photos – just the write-up sections]
© Michelle Dumas 2023 5
Strategy: Surveillance (CPTED)
• [we will see this next week]
• Defined
• Can be “natural” or “mechanical”
• Assignment: can be natural or mechanical –
need to specify
© Michelle Dumas 2023 6
CC100 3/13/23
© Michelle Dumas 2023 4
Strategy: Access control (CPTED)
• Defined
• Risks of committing crime – becomes harder
• Assignment: can be natural or mechanical –
need to specify
© Michelle Dumas 2023 7
Assignment Submissions
• You can submit more than one assignment if you
make changes. Only the most recent file will be
graded.
• You can submit a second file in PDF, as long as
one is in Word/text format
• It will go through Turnitin.com
© Michelle Dumas 2023 8
CC100 3/13/23
© Michelle Dumas 2023 5
Breakdown of Marks (out of 50)
(15% of final grade)
• Each Example of CP: 20 marks each (40 total)
• Photo (5 marks)
• Strategy type and Crime Prevention (10 marks)
• Evaluation (5 marks)
• Formatting (assignment): 5 marks
• Writing: 5 marks
© Michelle Dumas 2023 9
Formatting Entire Assignment (5 marks)
• Follow instructions (read everything)
• Submission is an electronic copy in one file in the
Dropbox (MyLS): in Word/text format
© Michelle Dumas 2023 10
CC100 3/13/23
© Michelle Dumas 2023 6
Formatting Entire Assignment (cont’d)
• The paper should be double-spaced, in 12-point Times
New Roman font, with one-inch margins in Word
format only.
• It also needs to include a title page that has a title,
your name, student ID number, course code and
name, university name and campus, and instructor’s
name.
• Each example needs to start on a new page and use a
title of the strategy type
© Michelle Dumas 2023 11
Rubric
(Excellent)
© Michelle Dumas 2023
• All formatting instructions
followed, including title
page requirements, font
size, font type, line spacing,
margin size, and page
numbers. Each example
has a subtitle and begins
on a new page. One file is
submitted in MS Word/text
format. 12
CC100 3/13/23
© Michelle Dumas 2023 7
A) Photo & Details (5 marks)
• A photo and details about where the photo was taken:
neighbourhood, city, the date it was taken, and time
of day. This information should be included in the first
sentence.
• There should be a general description to your reader.
That is, what should I be focused on in the picture(s)?
The photo will be graded on the evidence of a crime
prevention strategy, how clear the strategy is, and its
originality (taken by you).
© Michelle Dumas 2023 13
A) Photo & Details (cont’d)
© Michelle Dumas 2023 14
CC100 3/13/23
© Michelle Dumas 2023 8
Rubric
(Excellent)
© Michelle Dumas 2023
• Picture(s) clearly connects to the
topic at hand (CP). Demonstrates
clear understanding of the purpose
of this assignment. Photo details
have been provided (location, date
and time). A general brief
description is provided to the
reader. Creativity and originality
are evident. Photo was taken this
school year. [your pics should not
be the same as any other student’s
pics] 15
B) Strategy Type & CP (10 marks)
• Begin this paragraph by identifying the strategy (i.e.,
surveillance or access control).
• Why is it this type of strategy? Make sure to explain
your reasoning by making explicit connections to the
literature (textbook and lecture) on these CPTED
strategies and to parts of the photo where this is
exhibited.
© Michelle Dumas 2023 16
CC100 3/13/23
© Michelle Dumas 2023 9
B) Strategy Type & CP (cont’d)
• All relevant factors should be discussed and
connected to the details from your picture to provide
evidence and will be evaluated on this. No online
sources should be used in this section.
© Michelle Dumas 2023 17
B) Strategy Type & CP (cont’d)
• Additionally, tell the reader how it is preventing crime.
Be specific and explicit.
© Michelle Dumas 2023 18
CC100 3/13/23
© Michelle Dumas 2023 10
Rubric I
(Excellent)
© Michelle Dumas 2023
• Correctly identifies the type of
strategy used (presented in the
photo) and whether it is natural or
mechanical. Explains clearly why
this strategy is exemplary. Excellent
work in explaining why the strategy
is applicable by using evidence
from the photo(s) and connecting
it to the literature on this strategy.
Information and evidence are
accurate, appropriate, and
integrated effectively. 19
Rubric II
(Excellent)
© Michelle Dumas 2023
• This fits the criteria of a
surveillance or access control
strategy.
• Excellent discussion of the
ways that crime has been
prevented by this strategy
with clear connections to the
photo(s). Clear and concise
explanations. 20
A) Photo & Details (cont'd)
• Picture(s) - should be clear how crime is being prevented; if you need more than one pic, include more than one
• Mav need more than one - from different angles or close-ups/further back (for context) to back-up arguments
•Originality: Your pictures should not look like any other students in the class - if vou submit the same thing as another student, you will both receive a zeroPhoto & Details (cont'd)
•It should have required details:
neighbourhood/city, time of day & date - this should be in first sentence of first paragraph
•Description: brief/general - tell me what to look at or what I'm looking at, in case it is not obvious (it is not always obviousB) Strategy Type & CP (cont'd)
•One way to do this: start with literature (cite in APA) - tell me a descriptor of the strategy and tell me where that is exemplified in the picture; then move to another element & tell me where that is in the picture
(etc.)Strategy Type & CP (cont'd)
•Additionally, tell the reader how it is preventing crime.
Be specific and explicit. (smaller part of this section)
• That is, how do you believe they are stopping crime from happening?
• Be specific! Spell it out for me (as if I do not know)
• You can use lecture & text to back this upEvaluation
•This is all about your thoughts on it. There is no right or wrong way to answer this - but you need to back up your arguments.
• Do you think this strategy works in this neighbourhood? [key] Why or why not?
[consider where it is being used)
•What improvement could help prevent crime even more? (even if vou think it is successful

请你安装该要求，基于我所提供的两个地点，写一篇英文文章

308 King St N, Waterloo, ON N2J 2Z2
https://www.google.com/maps/place/308+King+St+N,+Waterloo,+ON+N2J+2Z2/@43.4786878,-80.5263162,18z/data=!3m1!4b1!4m6!3m5!1s0x882bf3f470e60a2f:0xb0d4560b866ebd82!8m2!3d43.4786859!4d-80.5252219!16s%2Fg%2F11csnl7v20
该地区是加拿大滑铁卢市的一所在建的豪华公寓，紧邻king street，Regina street和hickory street，其中紧邻Regina street的方向是各种建材和工程车辆进出和施工的地方，这里布满了各个方向的摄像头，大多数都对着这里的出入口和周边的街道，其周围的三条街两边都是居民区，有个人的别墅和大型公寓楼房，也有部分商店，其中大部分是餐馆，车流量很大，周围很热闹。https://www.accommod8u.com/308-king-street-north?gclid=Cj0KCQjw8e-gBhD0ARIsAJiDsaUFiY3gf70Sm1OBJhlGcD01uS\_gQ0XXr9OmqEoe7hzLxoO84qszC0saAtMjEALw\_wcB 这是该公寓的网址。

Holbeach Crescent及其周边的街道 https://www.google.com/maps/place/Holbeach+Crescent,+Waterloo,+ON/@43.4900707,-80.5207636,17z/data=!4m15!1m8!3m7!1s0x882bf3948dc70b87:0xa21d7f2c2e446e45!2sHolbeach+Crescent,+Waterloo,+ON!3b1!8m2!3d43.4891289!4d-80.5189719!16s%2Fg%2F1vxw8xms!3m5!1s0x882bf3948dc70b87:0xa21d7f2c2e446e45!8m2!3d43.4891289!4d-80.5189719!16s%2Fg%2F1vxw8xms

该地区是滑铁卢最著名之一的别墅区，其中有许多大型别墅，其中出去早晚高峰之外车流量和居民进出很少。基本上所有别墅都被围墙包围了起来，这些围墙都有2米多高，大部分围墙都经过翻新，用金属材质的栅栏替换了木制栅栏。许多户主在别墅外布置了摄像头，用来监视周围的活动。许多别墅的门口都使用了可视化门铃，一些个人家庭居住的别墅使用了机械结构的钥匙锁，另一些进行出租的别墅则换成了电子的密码锁。该地区挨着滑铁卢的两条主干道，Lexington Rd和Conestoga Pkwy（高速路），车流量极大。该地区还挨着Forwell Trail/Waterloop，是一个公园，时常能看见徒步或是跑步的人。
